definition: (Internet slang) to recommend a product to sb

sentences.english: What I really do is grow grass.
Planting trees and grass can not only resist but also fix sand.
sentences.chinese: 植树种草既能阻沙，又能固沙。

sentences.english: This paper records 3 genera 4 species lacewings from Mt. Mogan of Zhejiang Province.
sentences.chinese: 本文记录了采自浙江省莫干山区4种草蛉。

sentences.english: The black cumin seed is known for its many uses.
sentences.chinese: 黑种草种子是著名的多种用途。

sentences.english: He takes up gardening after his retirement.
sentences.chinese: 退休后他以养花种草作为消遣。

sentences.english: Water poultry industry should focus on cultivating grass to raise goose. Meanwhile, special poultry industry can be steadily enlarged.
sentences.chinese: 水禽业要加快发展种草养鹅，逐步扩大特禽生产。

sentences.english: The black cumin seed is a tiny, about 3mm long, and is hairy.
sentences.chinese: 黑种草种子是一个关于3毫米小，长，是毛茸茸的。

definition: (neologism c. 2015) (slang) (used jokingly) to live on dirt (typically because one has spent all one's money on consumer items)
reasonably priced/inexpensive/to keep prices down/(currency exchange) parity
darlings/fans/followers/short form of 親愛的們|亲爱的们
(slang) Japan (loanword from the Japanese word for Japan, "Nihon")
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
